com.jumio.nv

Class NetverifySDK

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.jumio.MobileSDK
      • com.jumio.nv.NetverifySDK

  • public final class NetverifySDK
extends MobileSDK
    Netverify & Fastfill SDK offers scanning and authentication of governmental issued IDs.

    • Method Detail

      • create

        public static NetverifySDK create(android.app.Activity rootActivity,
                                  java.lang.String apiToken,
                                  java.lang.String apiSecret,
                                  JumioDataCenter dataCenter)
                           throws PlatformNotSupportedException,
                                  java.lang.NullPointerException
        Creates an NetverifySDK instance
        Parameters:
        rootActivity - rootActivity which starts the NetverifySDK
        apiToken - The API token of your Jumio merchant account
        apiSecret - The corresponding API secret
        dataCenter - Select the JumioDataCenter (US, EU)
        Returns:
        An initialized NetverifySDK instance
        Throws:
        PlatformNotSupportedException - if the current platform is not supported by the sdk
        java.lang.NullPointerException - the provided rootActivity must not be null

      • create

        public static NetverifySDK create(android.app.Activity rootActivity,
                                  java.lang.String offlineToken,
                                  java.lang.String preferredCountry)
                           throws PlatformNotSupportedException,
                                  SDKExpiredException,
                                  java.lang.NullPointerException
        Creates an NetverifySDK instance
        Parameters:
        rootActivity - rootActivity which starts the NetverifySDK
        offlineToken - The API token of your Jumio merchant account
        preferredCountry - The preferred country (format: ISO 3166-1 Alpha 3 code)
        Returns:
        An initialized NetverifySDK instance
        Throws:
        PlatformNotSupportedException - if the current platform is not supported by the sdk
        java.lang.NullPointerException - the provided rootActivity must not be null
        SDKExpiredException - if the provided offline token has already expired

      • getDebugID

        public static java.lang.String getDebugID()
        Obtains the Jumio Analytics session ID if one already exists. Otherwise null is returned. A debug ID is generated during SDK construction.
        Returns:
        The id identifying a debug session, null if none exists.

      • setCallbackUrl

        public void setCallbackUrl(java.lang.String callbackUrl)
        Callback URL (max. 255 characters) for the confirmation after the verification is completed. This setting overrides your Jumio merchant settings.
        Parameters:
        callbackUrl - custom callback url

      • setEnableEMRTD

        public void setEnableEMRTD(boolean enable)
        Setting this to true will enable reading the NFC chip embedded in IDs and use it to increase verification speed and security. This flag is true by default. Several preconditions must be met:
        • Device has NFC capability
        • NFC chip is switched on, if not, a dialog will appear later
        • setEnableVerification(boolean) is set to true
        • A country signing certificate (CSC) can be found for the given country.
        Parameters:
        enable - if set to false, reading eMRTDs is not offered. If set to true and all of the above mentioned criteria are met, scanning eMRTDs is enabled.

      • sendDebugInfoToJumio

        public void sendDebugInfoToJumio(boolean send)
        Enable sending debug information to Jumio servers even if that feature is disabled on server-side
        Parameters:
        send - if set to true, the server setting is overridden. setting it to false will use the server setting.

      • setWatchlistScreening

        public void setWatchlistScreening(NVWatchlistScreening watchlistScreening)
        Override the server default for the watchlist search
        Parameters:
        watchlistScreening - ENABLED, DISABLED or DEFAULT

      • initiate

        public void initiate(NetverifyInitiateCallback loadingCallback)
              throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Initiates the SDK asynchronously All the SDK settings will be loaded before the SDK is displayed. The SDK can be started as soon as the NetverifyInitiateCallback is called
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the callback is null
